title: Some sort of action needs to be taken against Garena

embed.description: Ruling Update - Iron Solari League BY GG Sphere - February 03, 2015 Greetings Ladies of the League! After the successful and fun inaugural event, we're excited to announce that our All-feminine tournament, The Iron Solari, will now be organized monthly. With the 2nd leg happening on February 22, 2015 at The Net.Com - Recto Manila.

body: I cannot even comprehend the ignorance and bigotry of this whole situation. And then for them to attempt to "resolve" the issue with a terribly written, half-assed apology makes it even worse. Their not actually sorry, just trying to cover their asses. I understand that Riot spoke out against their ruling, but there's no way Garena should get away with such a ridiculous statement without some sort of repercussion.

replies.body: Agreed. Riot should not associate with this company if they want to implement those sorts of policies. I get that they primarily serve East Asia where social norms are different, but a multinational company like Riot cannot support or condone policies that support such narrow-minded views.

I think the point here is that Garena made an outright segregated tournament statement, and the fix thereof was essentially "whoops, guess not".  Not only is it extraordinarily misguided to make a ruling based on the fact women with a different sexual preference have magical wizard powers when it comes to League of Legends, but they literally said in the ruling that these groups (lesbian, transgender, etc.) are not considered women by the organization.

I'm not saying there needs to be further punishment or anything, just elucidating what the OP was going for.

>I think the point here is that Garena made an outright segregated tournament

Yeah, they have an all female tournament.

>all female tournament

To an extent I can kind of understand this.  I am a terrible point of reference since I'm male and don't live in that region, but from what I've gathered the professional scene is very much a boys' club.  It's not directly exclusive, per se, but there is an aura that isn't necessarily...inclusive.  I'm not saying it's particularly nice to see a gender-specific tournament (especially since there is no documented competitive gender advantage), but I can also kind of see the logic behind it.

Segregating based on sexual preference, however?  ...no.  Just no.

There is documented gender competitive advantages though. That is why most sports, digital or otherwise, tend to segregate. Obviously physical strength differences don't apply like in sports but the difference in reaction timing is a thing.

This is why I kinda said its somewhat barely reasonable for them to not allow transgendered but makes no sense whatsoever to bar lesbians.
Feel free to provide documentation that points to the inferiority of women's reaction times as compared to men.

And, more importantly, why do you feel the need to completely change the subject when an actual injustice is the topic here?

>It's the same with pretty much every sport. Why is it such a problem with LoL?

In many sports there is an actual documented physiological advantage due to men's generally higher upper body strength.  League of Legends, however, is about brain activity.  I don't think there's any evidence to support the idea that men have a competitive advantage in non-athletic sports, but I could be wrong.

>And, more importantly, why do you feel the need to completely change the subject when an actual injustice is the topic here?

Lol I just don't really have any pity or moral outrage. A tournament literally designed to exclude a certain group of people, is being criticized for not excluding the right group of people. Sorry but the whole thing is just comical, all of the butthurt is just kinda embarrassing.

So, unless they really are anti-gay/trans, the only reason to have this kind of ruling might be to keep the male players that they want to keep out from cross dressing and getting in anyways. That's the only situation that I can think of (aside from them possibly actually being ignorant dicks) that would prompt a ruling like that. 

Now, here's the thing: This is not a game or whatever that men are inherently better at than women. They probably want to do this type of event for the same reason that gay bars exist; sometimes people want their own version of something where they can do what everyone else is doing but with people of similar interests. Women (of all types, even those with male anatomy who identify as female) just want to play a game they enjoy with fellow females. If a man cross dressed (posing as a trans woman) just to get in so he could stomp on women in a game, he's pretty much doing the same thing as faking mental retardation to win the special Olympics (sorry for sounding like I'm saying women are like mentally retarded people, just hear me out.). The social stigma of pulling a stunt like that pretty much assures that it won't happen. It would put a big old sign on his neck saying that he thinks that women suck at League, and that he needs to validate himself by beating them. Sometimes you really don't need real rules to keep people out; social mores keep a lot of people from doing bad things naturally.
Does Riot have the power to remove Garena's privilege to use their game in this tourney?
yes
